text:
I hate to give such low reviews, so I really debated about bumping this one up to two stars, at the very least. But, ultimately, these breads are inedible to me, and that is just the truth. 

The positives were that they still had a number of items when I arrived at 4:30 pm, and the employee working was super friendly and helpful.

I ordered the pumpkin bread, cinnamon brioche, and bacon/cheese/jalapeno brioche. The pumpkin bread was unacceptably dry. It quickly ended up in the trash. It was cute, but I would rather it be hideous and delicious.

Where the pumpkin bread was dry, the brioche was the absolute complete opposite. It was like putting an entire stick of butter in your mouth. I am not joking when I say that the butter was dripping off of it. The flavors of the bread were overpowered by the straight butter. I must admit that I am not a fan of butter, but I love brioche. This brioche was the exception to that. Brioche in France was nothing like this. I took one bite of each and then was done with both. I can only imagine how many calories are in each bun. I don't know that I could have finished one, even if I had wanted to. 

The breads are also incredibly expensive. I get it: this is a labor intensive product. You deserve to charge a premium for this amount of effort. But for $5 per bun, it should be the best thing that I have ever eaten. It's sadly not. 

I'm sorry, Brioche, but I will not be back.
Very bad costumer service. Not organized they allow people to cut in line. Coffee was good but they got my order wrong :/

i've been a big fan of guy savoy--i've been to the paris and las vegas restaurants several times. and it's always a highlight when the bread guy comes by with the huge assortment of breads.  so i was happy to try the brioche stand inside caesars.

overall--at 730 am, the banana/nutella morning bun was stale. they did their best to heat it up to revive--but honestly, nothing beats the taste and overwhelming body reaction to fresh pastries. this was not one of those moments. even bouchon at the venetian is so much better than this. i am sad to admit that the donuts at America (inside NY NY) are far superior to this.

i've heard (though haven't confirmed) that the reason why the pastries taste stale are... because they ARE stale.  are they baked every morning or day? is there an oven pumping them out every 2-3 hours?  Try, maybe every 3 days I've heard.  That's why they have to revive them in the mini-oven.  Will you get a freshly baked pastry or a two day old one? If you like gambling in vegas, this is your bakery.  i am absolutely open to putting updated information here if someone from management can confirm that the pastries are baked throughout the day, or at least daily.  please tell me what time they enter the stand so i can go there and wait to buy fresh ones. 

the service people are nice enough but often not waiting around the register. i know it's boring to stand there--and there's work to be done behind those swaying doors. but i often wait around for 10-30 seconds waiting to see if the stand has been abandoned. when no one is there, it does look closed really.  

if i were guy savoy...i don't know if i'd feel good about this place with my name on it.  if you had really fresh pastries cycling in (like those humble donut stores in LA) throughout the day, then i'd be a huge fan and willing to put out the "dough." but i don't think they grill up a steak 2 days before at Guy Savoy and then reheat it for you when you order it today, right?

rule of thumb--if the pastries are good, there is usually a line. or constant turnover. there is no need to reheat fresh pastries.  there is hardly a line for this humble set up. if it were better, though, i'm sure there would be a line as the location is actually fairly convenient and the pastries sound/look good. i want to like it--but for $10.22 for a coffee and a small pastry--it's a bit of a disappointment given the brand.
I got an exotic pastry from here that was a croissant with pineapple and coconut. It was too sweet, it was too doughy and costumer service was okay.

$9 bucks for a sandwich is normal
$5.50 for a Pepsi is apparently normal at all restaurants in the hotel. Lol
$9.50 for a strawberry parfait is unbelievable lol


I give 3 stars because I think it is over priced.  

The sandwich was good but I was not expecting to spend $25 for lunch. Lol.  I will return but only get sandwich. And get soda out of the vending machine for $3 and get a parfait from somewhere.

Brioche is a small little shop inside of Caesars Palace by Chef Guy Savoy that offers baked goods, coffee, and sandwiches.  The service here has been fast and friendly.  However, as one can imagine, everything is expensive on the strip so be prepared to spend at least $27 on two coffees, breakfast sandwich, and a banana.  If you check into Yelp and show the cashier your phone, you can get a free croissant, plain or flavored, heated up or cold.  My bf did enjoy their coffee and breakfast sandwich.  Other than that, I'll make this review short and sweet unlike my other reviews.  As someone who had to make a lifestyle change and become gluten-free, not by choice, Brioche does not have much to offer to the gluten intolerance crowd except for fresh fruits such as bananas.  They do not have any gluten free pastries.

I understand this spot is small and new- but when Guy Savoy puts his name on it, I expect better. I'm not a pastry expert, but the menu is small and specialized so each item should be well executed, and I did not find this to be the case.

The BRIONINI (panini made using brioche bread) comes in three varieties, I tried the "proscuitto, tomato, and cheese" ($13)- maybe it was the bread type, or maybe it was the grill not being hot enough, but the bread was so soft that the only thing making it a panini was the grill imprints. Flavors worked well together, but the proscuitto seemed more like deli ham than any proscuitto I've tried. 

Grabbed a trio of the beautiful sweet  and savory brioche (3/$13)- the peanut butter and jelly was totally plain as if I was given the wrong one, bacon cheese and jalapeno tasted like a mouthful of grease?, Nutella and banana recommended by cashier was generous with the chocolate but covered up any hint of fruit. They were all nicely flaky but SOOO greasy.  A short walk to eat them and the cardboard box was coated with oily film- perhaps the dough was under-kneaded? We did not finish any of them.

For such simple fare, I expected better execution, especially given the price point. I'd hesitate to come back for even a simple croissant and coffee until they've had time to improve. Darrin was especially friendly during my visit but the namesake brioche was not up to par.

Best pastries ever! Get them warmed. Forget the calories, you'll walk them off just getting here! Chocolate croissant, cinnamon brioche & great coffee. Perfect quick go- to without taking time for a restaurant.
Amazing iced latte! Didn't even add sugar or simple syrup!

Service is slow. Only one girl was working, even though she was nice, the people in front of me ordered 3 coffees and she had to do them one by one. It took her like 10 mins. All I wanted was to grab a brioche and check in get my free croissant. I was gonna get a coffee but I had to go to work. Based on how long I waited I did not want to wait for more to have a coffee. I got almond and dried fruits brioche. I did not taste much almond. Brioche was dry and texture was very mediocre. Croissant was not bad but it is hard to screw up a croissant. Will not go back for their brioche. Maybe I'll try their coffee some time.
We stopped here on the way to the Forum Shops. The staff was friendly and the coffee was fresh and delicious.

This is a stand on the casino floor.  We got Brioninis pesto and vegetarian with 2 coffees.  The pesto was so oily that neither one of us could eat more than 4 bites.  

I wish the pesto wasn't so oily...otherwise, it would have been delicious.

The coffee was delicious!

Hmmm wanted to grab a cup of good coffee & brioche before a work meeting. There were only 3 guys ahead of me but the cashier took over 15-20 mins over simple orders for each person. Coffee tasted alright. I was looking forward to the brioche. Got a Nutella & banana (warmed up), but it was ok. Price was also overrated. You wonder why the line was short.

Ordered the Nutella banana brioche. Was fairly disappointed as it was nothing special. It barely had any Nutella inside, so It felt like I was mostly just eating bread/dough.

It was cooked extremely well, so I didn't mind eating just the plain brioche. Just a bit disappointed.

This was okay!! Expected so much more than what I got. The customer service was horrible, the last was rude and didn't warm my pastry up enough so the  cheese can be soft. I asked the employee of i could get a cup of hot water, she told me they only sell tea, i asked her do you only sell tea bags or do they come with water, and she literally just ignored my question like she didn't understand me. Overall this is a quick bite of you need something to get you by for a few hours.. They have no  seating incase you wanted to hangout...
Always excellent service. Great coffee and great pastries. It is a welcome change from Starbucks. Right by the front doors too. Croissants are delicious.
Quick service great coffee. Having bran muffin looks yummy

Not bad for a quick coffee and bite . Got myself a black ice coffee which was a bit weird because I was waiting for my order and realized I saw everyone else
Coming to another line and giving the person there receipt and they would make the drink . So 2 people went ahead of me :- / got a plain croissant for checking in and buying a coffee . Overall was just okay here .

This place is definitely a trap and is so strategically placed inside the main casino area at Caesar's Palace so it won't matter how expensive that cup of joe is. You'll get it anyways! I did and paid $6 for a small latte which actually wasn't milky and smooth at all, but kind of rather burnt in flavor. They have a rather basic offering of mediocre coffee but also have wine, beer, brioches, baked goods and sandwiches. All at inflated prices, but hey... it's convenient especially when you're on fire and have that itch to keep spinning at the slot machines.

Small stand with no seating next to the valet entrance inside the Caesars casino.

Menu 9/10/2016
*~Brioche~* 1pc -  $4.96 /  3 for $13 / 6 for $24
--Sweet--
Almond & Candied Fruit
Exotic (pineapple & coconut)
Nutella & Banana

Cinnamon

--Savory--

Vegetarian: $8

*~Alcoholic Beverages~*
Barefoot Wines: $6
Champagne: Barefoot - $7 / Chandon - $10 / La Marca - $12
Beer: ($9) Coors Light / Heineken

*~Bottled Beverages~*
Fiji / Perrier / San Pellegrino / Coconut Water / Iced Tea: $6.50
Red Bull / Juices / Soft Drink: $5.50

Maybe it was because we went at 2PM but the brioche we bought were all dry and stale tasting (yet somehow there was a lot of oil stains in the box within the 5min walk back to our hotel room). I had the exotic while the BF had the Nutella. The exotic had large chunks of fruit which were a little hard to eat (they should probably cut into smaller pieces). I wasn't much a fan. The BF's Nutella look burnt and tasted dry w/ very little Nutella. BF took one bite of the PB&J (the only brioche not warmed up) and threw the rest away.

Definitely not recommended.

Absolutely amazing!! I came here during their soft opening and was not disappointed. The croissants are perfect- soft, with a slight crisp and loaded with flavor. It is pricey, but you are paying for quality. Nothing else like this on the Vegas Strip! Highly recommended.

The service here is good. Friendly baristas. I am a picky person when it comes to coffees and lattes. But the Hot Mocha from here is rich and delicious. My only difference is they only have small cups. I'm a coffee attic. I need LARGE.

I grabbed a cinnamon brioche in passing while on the way to a meeting with my husband. I was worried as I had read negative  reviews. The coffee was ok nothing special. The brioche was really greasy. I am morbidly obese and from Indiana: This won't stop me. The brioche wasn't dry (something I wouldn't tolerate in a brioche) and the filling was as expected. If you had any sense of health the amount of grease might be a deal breaker. Once I blotted with a napkin I was ok with it. You would be better suited to make the walk to payard or jean Phillipe if you want gourmet grab and go in the area.

Cute little spot to get a quick coffee or treat. I had their chocolate croissant and let me tell you it was soft and super delicious. The coffee was good as well, but did not have an extra kick to it. It was also reasonably priced and easy to get to right by the main entrance of the hotel. Don't forget to check in so you can claim your croissant you won't regret it.

Brioche eh?
I visited this location twice on two separate visits to Vegas. 
After seeing the Vegas prices I thought that maybe it had the Vegas taste.
It seems this is a one man stand and if there is any other customers, you should be prepared to wait.
I have tasted a latte from here and it seems like from reviews that it just depends on the barista. It seemed mine had burned the milk and it wasn't very pleasant. 
The chocolate cookie can't be too hard to mess up but it seems here it is a very thick almost cake like cookie that doesn't have much sugar in the recipe. It was not really my style.
On our recent visit, my boyfriend picked up three different sweet brioche's; Peanut Butter and Jelly, Nutella, and Cinnamon. It seemed that the Nutella was the winner. The cinnamon was OK but still needed some more sweetness. Maybe it is the american in me? The peanut butter and Jelly had some good flavor but there was only a small amount of jelly on the top for show and none throughout so it definitely needed more.
This is a prime location and it is unfortunate that this falls short.

I love Guy Savoy and Brioche, his casual offering at Caesars, was no exception. The pastries here the morning we went we're very fresh and flaky. Perhaps we hit it at the right time, having just arrived right after opening. Still, I have to say that this stand does not live up to his name in terms of quality and service. The restaurant upstairs remains to this day the best meal I have ever had in my entire life.
The coffee and espresso are so good! Free croissant was also a delicious. What's not good is the price. I paid $9.50 for a hazelnut latte. Wow.

Loved this. Coffee and brioche $10.00. Great flavor, dark roast coffee but not bitter. Different brioche options from exotic fruit to cinnamon. I had the almond and dried fruit. Wonderful. Friendly service. Should have saved myself $25.00 difference and had breakfast here yesterday.

Decided to grab a quick bite while waiting for a ride. I didn't feel like walking all the way to the food court and lucky enough there was this grab and go stand right by the Main Entrance! I'm familiar with Guy Savoy and I know how pricey his food can cost so this more affordable take definitely caught my attention.
 
They have a really cool touch screen menu where you can browse through their products and their prices. They offer a variety of coffee and brioche. I looked over to the side where there are samples of what the pastries looked like which came in handy in terms of size and portion. 

I went with the Cinnamon Brioche! I was surprised to see how it was packaged... The cashier, while handling the food, basically mushed it flat as she was attempting to place the sticker on plastic wrapper. I also noticed that a good portion of the brioche was stuck on to the paper cup that it was placed in. But food is food so I still ate it and it was not too bad! It filled me up so I'm satisfied. I would come back for convenience. Otherwise, I would probably just walk over to the Food Court.

While walking around Caesar's had a craving for coffee. Found this little shop on the corner inside the casino area and was pleasantly surprised. Ended up ordering a hot chocolate as well which was delicious. A little too sweet, but very tasty on a cold day. I also got the chocolate chip cookies. It wasn't as tasty as it looked, but definitely massive and no doubt had lots of butter, which I always like. It just kind of tasted bland and nothing too special. Still a good cookie, but probably wouldn't order it again.

The girls at the front were sweet and pleasant, we didn't wait too long for our order. Definitely a little pricey, but it was a good spot for a quick stop for sweets.

After being bummed out Jean-Phillipe Patissetie closed I settled for late night coffee and pastries at Brioche. I didn't check the yelp reviews - I guess I should have. We spent maybe $55 for 9 pastries and 2 drip coffees. No big deal - Vegas prices. But the Nutella brioche was non existent. I expected a hefty layer inside. I also ordered the almond one but got the exotic one instead. We got the chocolate croissant which barely had any chocolate chips and no filling. Lastly I we got bran muffins and blueberry muffins. Ok being real here - the blueberry muffin was the ONLY thing that tasted like blueberries and was moist. Now it's back to square one finding a good cafe. Boo!

***Bisaya review***

Dugay na jud ko gusto moadto dinhi pero karon ra kahigayon. Ang babae na nitabang nice kaayo, ni order me tong special nila nga 3 for $13, almond and fruit, PB & J, og Nutella nga nahurot dayun sa akong anak laki. Gipangutana me og gusto ba daw namo ipainit, oo dayun me. It was warm, flaky og lami jud. Highly recommend!

Convenient when you need a quick breakfast. They have a variety of sweet and savory brioche, some sandwiches and coffee/espresso drinks. I tried the bacon, cheddar and jalapeño brioche and the prosciutto and cheese brioche. Both were tasty, but quite greasy.

I tried both the Nutella banana brioche and the cinnamon. Essentially, Yuck. So greasy that they make butter croissants seem healthy. I didn't expect cold brioche to saturate the pastry box with grease, but they did. Beyond that, the brioche didn't taste good at all. I have a half left that I can't force myself to eat. That doesn't happen with me and pastries.

The iced coffee was quite good, but it was also $7, so I didn't bother bumping my review up by one star because of it.

Missing some of the old options at Bellagio that have closed or moved, we stopped at Brioche for an afternoon treat mid-walk. The prices and calories are both a little higher than we'd like, or consider really worth it, but there are some interesting flavor options that are worth a try if you're a particular fan.
We tried the plain brioche (okay, but not worth the calories it contained or the price it cost - go wait in line at Bouchon and get something spectacular instead) and the pineapple coconut brioche (fine, but the filling was all in one tiny area so it was messy and not that interesting).
The coffees were really great - so perhaps they're best as just a swing-through for a great café au lait!

$16 for a (small) iced coffee and a (barely edible) sandwich. Service was pleasant but incredibly slow: had only three people ahead of me and somehow still took 15 minutes to get up to the cash register to order. Time to get food/drink was pretty fast, and iced coffee tasted pretty standard (aka not worth the $6 I paid for it). Sandwich however tasted stale and mushy, and despite the $10 I had spent I couldn't bring myself to finish it. I understand that prices will always be marked up in hotels, but there are so many other things counting against this I will definitely venture out elsewhere for my caffeine fix.

I was so excited when Guy Savoy opened a little shop at Caesars. I was really disappointed with what I tried which was practically all the different brioche and pastry they offered. The brioche was dry as I was expecting it to be flaky and soft. I would rather go to Bouchon Bakery. Sorry Guy, your restaurant is still in my #1 list.
Coffee is definitely not that great... way overpriced. Bad service as well. Definitely would hit Starbucks instead

2018 Yelp 100 Challenge!
23/100

Made a visit on 3/3/2018 - Saturday afternoon for coffee and a sandwich (literally a quick bite) our service was great!

Let me add that our guy Michael made our visit very pleasing.. here's why:

- By himself he was working it!
- Knew I needed my sandwich cut in half: I didn't even need to ask..he told me! 
- Provided my order with a bag and enough napkins (that's something I also ask..sometimes even at sbucks haha)

Damn.. I didn't even have to ask for anything.. :)

THANK YOU Michael!!
